id.kaytrust.core.identity.ethereum.admin

Class EthereumIdentityManagerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • id.kaytrust.core.identity.ethereum.admin.EthereumIdentityManagerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IdentityManager, EthereumIdentityManager

    public class EthereumIdentityManagerImpl
extends Object
implements EthereumIdentityManager
    This implementation is designed to work with Ethereum Networks. At a high level a user or an administrator can use an instance of this class to create an identity and authorize a user's device public key to access its identity.

    The "identity concept" is materialized through a Proxy smart contract. Each user is able to create its own identity in two ways:

    • by deploying a new Proxy instance directly.
    • By using an Identity Manager smart contract instance.

    Even when it is possible to give a direct access of a running instance of this class, the design is intended to allow access to only an admin of an identity Provider.

    From the flow view when an identity provider admin uses this instance, it connects to an Identity Manager Contract instance that lives on the Ethereum network. As mentioned above, if an admin wants to create a Proxy (on behalf of a final user) the Identity Manager Contract will deploy Proxy smart contract instance and also will authorize the end user's device to access the newly deployed Proxy instance.
    Author:
    Egdard Espinoza Rivas, Erick Pacheco Pedraza

    • Constructor Detail

      • EthereumIdentityManagerImpl

        public EthereumIdentityManagerImpl(String hostRpc,
                                   String token,
                                   String privateKey,
                                   String contractAddress,
                                   int blockTime)
                            throws ParamEmptyException
        Sets an instance to interact with the Identity Manager ethereum smart contract.
        Parameters:
        hostRpc - host and port where ethereum node serves RPC requests
        token - can be blank, is token field Authorization
        privateKey - The private key used to interact with the smart contract.
        contractAddress - Contract Address Identity Manager.
        blockTime - time mining of block in milliseconds, it's optional by default it's 15000
        Throws:
        ParamEmptyException - if a required parameter is empty.

      • authorizeDevice

        public void authorizeDevice(String did,
                            String publicKeyDevice,
                            String capability)
                     throws MnidInvalidAddressException,
                            IOException,
                            org.web3j.protocol.exceptions.TransactionException,
                            ParamEmptyException,
                            CapabilityException
        Description copied from interface: IdentityManager
        Authorizes a user's device address to access its identity. The Identity implemetation depends of the blockchain network that is used.
        Specified by:
        authorizeDevice in interface IdentityManager
        Parameters:
        did - The Decentralized identifier.
        publicKeyDevice - The public key associated with a user's device
        capability - The capability that grants authorization to the user's device over an identity living on a DLT.
        Throws:
        MnidInvalidAddressException - mnid format error
        IOException - network exception
        org.web3j.protocol.exceptions.TransactionException - transaction in blockchain error
        ParamEmptyException - if a required parameter is empty.
        CapabilityException - capability no present

      • createIdentity

        public String createIdentity()
                      throws IOException,
                             org.web3j.protocol.exceptions.TransactionException
        Description copied from interface: IdentityManager
        This method allows to create an identity (Proxy Contract) through the identity manager smart contract.

        The Proxy Contract is intended to represent users in the blockchain network. Each user has a unique Proxy Smart contract instance.

        Specified by:
        createIdentity in interface IdentityManager
        Returns:
        The string that represents the contract address where the newly created Proxy Smart contract has been deployed.
        Throws:
        IOException - network exception
        org.web3j.protocol.exceptions.TransactionException - transaction in blockchain error
